fieldData.title: More active labour market policy
fieldData.calc_minorCategory: Supporting businesses to get back to normal
fieldData.descriptionBackgroundInfo: As unemployment is expected to rise as a consequence of the COVID-19 outbreak, increased funding has been allocated to the Swedish public Employment Service (Arbetsförmedlingen) and labour market policy programmes. The period during which a person may have a subsidized form of employment is extended by an additional year for those who already have such jobs. Additionally, the maximum time for support for starting a business is extended from 6 to 12 months. Municipalities will receive grants for more summer jobs for young people and funding for 'green jobs'.
fieldData.descriptionContentOfMeasure: The measure to increase spending on Active labour market policy includes:1. Increased funding to the Public Employment Service (Arbetsförmedlingen) (SEK 0.33 billion);2. Summer jobs for young people (SEK 0.18 billion);3. Green jobs (i.e. jobs in the environmental goods and services sector, to enable subsidized employment, primarily in the area of nature and forest conservation) (SEK 0.15 billion);4. More programme measures (SEK 1.87 billion);5. Extended time in measures  (subsidized employment forms include ‘extra jobs’, new start jobs or introductory jobs) and support for business (SEK 0.05 billion).In total, spending on ALMP is increased by SEK 2.58 billion.
fieldData.descriptionUseOfMeasure: There is currently no data on the uptake of this measure.
fieldData.statusOfRegulation: New aspects included into existing measure

sources.sources::title: Crisis package for jobs and transition
The maximum duration for extra and introductory jobs is extended (Maxtiden för extratjänster och introduktionsjobb förlängs)

updates.updates::description: The Government has decided to extend the duration of temporary measure that allows for extension of subsidised forms of employment until the end of 2021. Same applies for the maximum time for support for starting a business.
